modules.description: Handles arithmetic operations on arbitrary-precision integers, including addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Works with custom big integer types and provides exact results for large numerical computations. Used for implementing cryptographic algorithms and financial calculations requiring high precision.

Controls behavior of rational number handling through flags. Adjusts whether null denominators trigger errors, enables or disables automatic normalization of ratios, and determines if rationals are printed as fractions or decimal approximations. Modifies precision for approximate decimal outputs and influences normalization timing during operations and printing.

The module provides arithmetic operations, comparisons, and conversions for arbitrary-precision rational numbers, enabling precise calculations in scenarios like financial modeling or scientific computations. It supports interactions with integers, floats, and string representations, along with formatting options for decimal and scientific notation, ensuring flexibility in numerical handling and edge-case management.

Provides arithmetic operations for rational numbers, including addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Works with the `ratio` type, representing fractions as numerator-denominator pairs. Used to implement precise numeric calculations in the Num module.

Formats natural numbers, big integers, rational numbers, and arbitrary-precision numbers using a formatter. Accepts specific numeric types including Nat.nat, Big_int.big_int, Ratio.ratio, and Num.num. Used to display precise numerical values in custom output formats.

The module offers low-level arithmetic, bitwise, and numerical operations on arbitrary-precision integers represented as digit arrays, including addition, multiplication, GCD, and base conversions. It manipulates data structures like `nat` (arrays of digits) and integers, enabling precise control over large number representations. Use cases include cryptographic algorithms, mathematical computations requiring exact precision, and systems needing efficient handling of non-standard numeric formats.

This module offers arithmetic operations (addition, multiplication, exponentiation), comparisons, and bitwise manipulations (AND, OR, shifts) on arbitrary-precision integers, alongside conversions between these integers and fixed-size types like int32, int64, and floats. It supports numerical analysis, type-safe conversions, and operations requiring precise control over binary or decimal representations. Use cases include cryptographic algorithms, financial calculations, and systems needing overflow-free integer handling.
